race.name: La Dr√¥moise Gravel
race.tagline: Vineyard passages and Vercors cliff views through the Dr√¥me and Bez valleys of France.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through French Alps. Significant elevation with mountain scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional France event. Alps terrain with medium local field and scenic challenge.

biased_opinion.summary: La Dr√¥moise Gravel is a regional event in France‚ÄîAlps terrain with significant elevation. The French Alps are stunning, but the medium local field, regional organization, and limited prestige keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional France Alps gravel race. Worth it for France/European riders. Not worth traveling internationally for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to France/Europe‚Äîyes, it's solid. If you're traveling internationally‚Äîskip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better France races: Gravel Fever, Wish One Millau.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Dr√¥me has limited lodging. Consider nearby cities.

non_negotiables.why: French Alps require sustained mountain effort.

logistics.explanation: Sunday 9h00 start on avenue du Texas with village d√©part at Meyrosse parking works, but GPS-only navigation puts route discovery entirely on riders - you get the GPX trace one week before. One rider noted being '√† genoux en train de retirer des cailloux de leurs chaussures' in the first kilometer, questioning if they really signed up for this.

length.explanation: Multiple gravel options run 27km, 55km, and 75km across the weekend format. The 75km course delivers 1300m climbing through Dr√¥me valleys with two feed stations at KM 23 and 61. Solidly middle-distance without being a sprint or epic suffer-fest, letting you pick your challenge level. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Course mixes 'petites routes goudronn√©es et de pistes caillouteuses avec certains passages techniques courts' through Dr√¥me terrain. The 75km route warns 'un parcours tr√®s exigeant √† destination des sp√©cialistes du gravel.' Expect rocky gravel sections that demand bike handling without requiring special skills. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds.

elevation.explanation: The 75km delivers 1300m climbing through valleys of the Dr√¥me and Bez with 'vue imprenable sur les falaises du Vercors sud.' Course moved to opposite slopes of Glandasse at the foot of Ch√¢tillon vineyard terrain. Respectable elevation gain that specialists will feel without being punitive. Similar elevation profile to Gravel Worlds.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 72¬∞F and lows of 54¬∞F, with a 43% chance of rain on any given day. September conditions vary significantly - one rider experienced 'le vent et le froid' but noted 'Le soleil √©tait au rendez vous.' Another mentioned 'Vent frais pour la saison' during mid-September timing. Cool winds and variable conditions are typical for the season in this region. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego. As Participant feedback puts it: "Congratulations to the top organization. I discovered the magnificent landscapes of the Vercors that I didn't really know, although coming from the Ard√®che plateau."

altitude.explanation: Course runs through Dr√¥me valley terrain at the foot of Vercors cliffs rather than high mountain elevations. Now positioned on opposite slopes of Glandasse near vineyard country, suggesting moderate hill country altitude without oxygen concerns or dramatic elevation changes. Modest altitude compared to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

adventure.explanation: Course explores 'les vall√©es de la Dr√¥me et du Bez' with vineyard passages and Vercors cliff views most international riders never see. One couple described 'Tout un week-end d'alternances entre randonn√©es cyclistes et voyages au c≈ìur de l'√©chapp√©e des rues' - cycling alternating with arts festival experiences.

prestige.explanation: 18th edition draws over 3,600 participants with Titouan Carod endorsing 'bravo √† l'organisation au top.' Elite rider Nathalie Baillon finished 2nd in 2022, but this remains a regional cyclosportive with gravel components rather than a destination race with international recognition.

race_quality.explanation: Multiple riders praised 'Une organisation exemplaire' with volunteers who 'nous ont accueillis et servis avec le sourire.' However, one organizer noted feed stations need more volunteers 'pour pouvoir distribuer les produits au rythme d'arriv√©e des participants' during peak arrivals.

experience.explanation: Riders experience 'l'ambiance atypique du gravel Diois' with good-natured atmosphere where cyclists exchange 'regards complices apr√®s avoir surv√©cu √† une descente p√©rilleuse.' The event runs alongside L'√âchapp√©e des Rues arts festival, blending cycling with cultural experiences.

community.explanation: Strong volunteer support earns praise: 'Un gros merci √©galement √† tous les b√©n√©voles qui nous ont accueillis et servis avec le sourire.' Organization quality gets consistent recognition from the 600+ gravel participants, but community remains primarily French regional rather than international gravel scene.

field_depth.explanation: Events are explicitly 'non chronom√©tr√©, il n'y aura donc pas de classement' - no timing, no rankings. Over 3,600 participants spread across multiple distances and three days dilutes competitive depth. Format attracts recreational riders rather than serious racing field. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Multi-day festival format offers three different course options with the gravel event integrated into arts festival weekend. Free 47-page preparation guide with LABICYCLE partnership included. Riders consistently praise organization quality for what appears to be reasonable French cyclosportive pricing.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs ‚Ç¨70-90. Die location in provincial Dr√¥me keeps accommodation costs regional rather than resort pricing. No major airport nearby requires driving or multiple connections through Lyon. Basic French village logistics work but expect regional standards rather than tourist amenities or luxury options. Higher total cost than Badlands.

key_takeaways: 2024 included new parcours like Friday in Baronnies and Ultra on Saturday/Sunday

primary.name: IRC Boken Double Cross
primary.why: Underrated mixed-terrain tire. Fast center with confident shoulder grip.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners
